document_data.caption: A map of [[Hartsvale]], showing [[Lake Woe]] to the south, with the mountain in its center.
document_data.name: Lake Woe mountain
document_data.georefs: <ref group="note" name="note1">The ''name'' "Lake Woe mountain" is not given in any canonical source, though all of its details given are canonical; the name is used solely for the purpose of having an article title for this significant mountain in the middle of [[Lake Woe]].
document_data.mainbody: '''Lake Woe mountain''' was one of the tallest mountains in northern [[Faer√ªn]] and the home to a [[Storm giant aerie of Lake Woe mountain|steading]] of [[storm giant]]s.<ref group="note" name="note1" />
document_data.Description: The peak rose high above most cloud cover yet was constantly bombarded by lightning storms. It was one of the hardest mountains to climb among all of the [[Ice Spires]]; only expert mountaineers stood a chance at summiting it.
document_data.Geography: The mountain rose from [[Lake Woe]], south of the Ice Spire mountains and north of the [[Ice Mountains]].<ref group="note" name="note2">[[Lake Woe]] is not labelled on any map, but its description places it south of the [[Ice Spires|Ice Spires South]], and only one lake on the maps fits that description. Lake Woe mountain is actually depicted in the center of the lake in the map included with the ''[[Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide]]''.
document_data.Flora & Fauna: Thousands of birds visited the mountain peak on those rare days when there were not thunderstorms.
document_data.Inhabitants: The mountain was the home to a steading of storm giants who had played a significant role in the [[War of the Hart]].
